alert.note: Alert for Boone; Hamilton; Hendricks; Marion; Montgomery (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 05 at 11:51AM EDT until April 05 at 12:30PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: The National Weather Service in Indianapolis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Hendricks County in central Indiana... Northwestern Marion County in central Indiana... Boone County in central Indiana... Southwestern Hamilton County in central Indiana... Southeastern Montgomery County in west central Indiana... * Until 1230 PM EDT. * At 1151 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles east of Crawfordsville to 14 miles north of Greencastle, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Advance around 1200 PM EDT. New Ross around 1205 PM EDT. Jamestown around 1210 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Lebanon, Ulen, Whitestown, Lizton, Brownsburg, Pittsboro, Westfield and Sheridan. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 124 and 145. Interstate 74 between mile markers 40 and 64. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM EDT for central and west central Indiana. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
